title: Powerful Dev Conference - Getting Started Assessment

elements.name: welcomeMessage
elements.html:
Welcome to the Getting Started Assessment

This assessment will help you get started by identifying your role and aligning you with the appropriate learning path and getting started reading.

elements.name: bestMatchingRole
elements.title: What is your best matching role?

elements.name: roleDescription
elements.html: You selected: {bestMatchingRole}. Here is a brief description of this role:

elements.name: businessAlignedUserDescription
elements.html:
Business Aligned User

Represents business stakeholders who have invested in the Power Platform and want to ensure automated testing is applied at the correct level. They are concerned with business continuity, solution performance, and mitigating security risks.

elements.name: architectDescription
elements.html:
Architect

Responsible for reviewing the pillars of the Power Well-Architected Framework and implementing quality control and integration with other information technology investments. They ensure holistic integration across low-code and code-first investments.

elements.name: technicalDescription
elements.html:
Technical

Includes roles such as DevOps Engineers, Software Engineers, and Support Engineers who are responsible for the overall Continuous Integration / Deployment process and integrating Power Platform into this process. They can manage source control integration, test assets, and quality processes for deployment and updates.

elements.name: stakeholderConcerns

elements.name: businessContinuityInfo
elements.html:
Business Continuity

Automated testing plays a critical role in ensuring business continuity by providing a safety net that ensures new features do not disrupt existing functionality. This continuous validation helps maintain the stability and reliability of the solutions, thereby supporting uninterrupted business operations.

elements.name: solutionPerformanceInfo
elements.html:
Solution Performance

Automated testing helps in identifying performance bottlenecks early in the development process, allowing for timely optimizations. By incorporating performance tests into the automated testing suite, you can ensure that the solutions meet the required performance standards and deliver a seamless user experience.

elements.name: securityRisksInfo
elements.html:
Security Risks

Automated testing includes security tests that validate the application's resilience to various attack scenarios. These tests ensure that the solutions comply with security best practices and protect sensitive business data. By integrating security tests into the automated testing process, you can proactively address potential vulnerabilities and safeguard the organization's assets.

elements.name: empoweringBusinessUsersInfo
elements.html:
Empowering Business Users

Low-code solutions offer a scalable way to empower business users to build solutions independently and in coordination with IT development teams or partners. Automated testing ensures that even solutions developed by non-technical users meet the organization's standards and can be scaled effectively.

elements.name: notSureInfo
elements.html:
Common Concerns Addressed by Automated Testing

  • Business Continuity: Ensures new features do not disrupt existing functionality, maintaining stability and reliability.
  • Solution Performance: Identifies performance bottlenecks early, ensuring solutions meet performance standards.
  • Security Risks: Validates resilience to attacks, ensuring compliance with security best practices.
  • Empowering Business Users: Ensures solutions developed by non-technical users meet organizational standards and can be scaled effectively.

elements.name: achievingBusinessGoalsInfo
elements.html:
Achieving Business Goals

Automated testing ensures that the solutions developed on the Power Platform meet the business goals set by stakeholders. It provides a reliable framework for validating the functionality and performance of the solutions, ensuring they align with business objectives and track performance against key metrics.

elements.name: demonstratingImpactQualityInfo
elements.html:
Demonstrating Impact and Quality

Automated testing provides evidence that the solutions are delivering the expected benefits and meeting the quality standards set by the organization. It ensures that the solutions meet the defined requirements and deliver consistent results, demonstrating their impact and quality.

elements.name: balancingCompetingPrioritiesInfo
elements.html:
Balancing Competing Priorities

Automated testing helps streamline the development process by providing faster feedback and reducing the need for extensive manual testing. This allows your team to focus on delivering high-quality solutions within the set timelines and resource constraints, balancing competing priorities effectively.

This involves developing comprehensive training programs that cover all aspects of low-code development.

Hands-on training sessions should include automated testing, enabling participants to practice creating and running automated tests. This helps them understand how automated testing can be integrated into the development process.

elements.name: ensuringContinuousLearningInfo

Ensuring Continuous Learning

Training programs should be regularly updated with the latest developments in low-code tools and automated testing practices. Continuous learning opportunities should be provided to keep participants informed about new tools and techniques.

elements.name: businessReleaseStage
elements.title: Which release stage do you prefer to participate in?

choices.text: Early Adopter (Understand the clear need for testing and want to be involved early to apply it now and steer product direction)
Beta User (Want to try experimental features but don't want to be at the cutting edge)
General Availability (Want to use features as they are ready for wider usage)

elements.name: earlyAdopterInfo
elements.html:
Early Adopter

As an early adopter, you understand the clear need for testing and want to be involved early to apply it now and steer product direction. Your feedback is crucial in identifying critical bugs and usability issues.

elements.name: betaUserInfo
elements.html:
Beta User

As a beta user, you want to try experimental features but don't want to be at the cutting edge. This stage aims to validate changes in a more diverse environment, ensuring updates work seamlessly across different configurations and use cases.

elements.name: generalAvailabilityInfo
elements.html:
General Availability

In the general availability stage, you want to use features as they are ready for wider usage. By this stage, updates are expected to be stable and reliable, having been vetted through previous testing stages.

elements.name: earlyAdopterRecommendations
elements.html:
Early Adopter Recommendations

As an early adopter, you can start reading the provided content and begin planning your testing strategies. Your involvement is crucial in steering product direction and ensuring that the solutions meet business needs.

elements.name: betaUserRecommendations
elements.html:
Beta User Recommendations

As a beta user, stay tuned and check back for updates on when features will be available for testing. Your feedback on experimental features will help refine them for general use.

elements.name: generalAvailabilityRecommendations
elements.html:
General Availability Recommendations

For general availability, discuss and think about the issues that are important to you. Provide feedback on what features and improvements you would like to see in the final release.
